wikipedia_page.main: Neil Peter Rees (born 28 April 1978) is a former Welsh international lawn and indoor bowler.

link_mentions.page: Lawn bowls at the 2006 Commonwealth Games

response: Professor Neil Rees is an Australian jurist and legal academic. He is a former Chairperson of the Victorian Law Reform Commission (VLRC),Victorian Law Reform Commission - New VLRC Head Victoria's chief law reform organisation.Victorian Law Reform Commission - About Us

After graduating, Rees was admitted as a Barrister and Solicitor in Victoria. He then worked in legal practice, including with the Aboriginal Legal Aid Service. Rees then moved into the public service to become Assistant Director of Policy and Research for the Victorian Attorney-General.ABC Melbourne - Chester Porter QC and Professor Neil Rees Following this, Rees moved into academia, taking up a position at the University of New South Wales as Director of Legal Education. In 1991, Professor Rees was appointed foundation Dean at the University of Newcastle Law School. His research focus as an academic was in equal opportunity law, employment law and administrative law. His prior appointments include President of the Mental Health Review Board and Chairman of the Psychosurgery Review Board.
